Click ? on that line to deep search
Also, copy paste that line and post in discord or steam workshop to notify SpaceNavy!

You can report the results of your games!
This data will be utilized for list building assistance, ELO calculation, and competitive card discussions!

HorizontalLayout.Text: Place Objective in Designated Spot on Left side of board!
Ranked Games will impact Competitive Ranking

Need Help?

HorizontalLayout.Text: Click the page numbers below to explore recent features

VerticalLayout.Text: How to get started?

HorizontalLayout.Text: Start with one of the Tutorial Datacards on the left OR

VerticalLayout.Text: Want to Contribute?

HorizontalLayout.Text: to Submit your finished game score to the cloud.

VerticalLayout.Text: If you are doing Proximity Mine shenanigans with moving obstacles:
Before moving, Click F6 to "attach" the proximity mines to the obstacle.
To free the mines, just "Attach" the obstacle to nothing.
If you need to reroll dice. Lock the ones you want to keep.
Then mash the roll button to roll the rest. This prevents accidental bumps!
Game Results can be recorded to the cloud!

HorizontalLayout.Text: Only takes a few seconds, start by clicking:

VerticalLayout.Text: Requires:
1. Both Players Present
2. Fleets spawned from GUI or Datacards
3. Objective in the designated spot left of board near turn counter ("Choose" button will move it there!)
Then all you have to do is:
1. click colors for 1st and 2nd player (filtered by the current players)
2. Type in Scores (This will have automated assistance in the future)
3. Click Submit!
Maneuvering Ruler can now be controlled by hotkeys!
By default, TTS hotkeys are mapped to numpad1-numpad9 and numpad0
For those without a numpad, I recommend remapping to: N M , H J K Y U I RightALT (Which will require remapping or unbinding: "nudge","magnify", "hide hand","under")
Default bindings are:
Obstacles can be found in brown bag on left side.
All Obstacles and Tokens now have Range 1-5 Rulers (Targeting has Close/Medium/Long).
After placing one click the "Lock" button.
To Check Range, click on the obstacles (It has a big invisible button)
The Obstacle will remember the last range used.
When ruler is visible, a "Move" button will appear to facilitate ranged obstacle movement.
On the left side of the table near the rules, you will find 4 datacards.
These represent the 4 default fleets in the Core/Fleet Starter "Let's Play" rulebooks.
Clicking: "Spawn Fleet" will create the fleet in front of you.
When lists are spawned from the Fleet Spawner, they will generate a "Datacard".
These can be saved for later by right clicking ► Save Object, and restored later by Objects ► Saved Objects
If you would like to capture your manually assembled list, Place all cards from your list on your side of the board, grab an empty datacard from between the dice rollers, and click "Store Fleet"
"Spawner" found on far right side of screen.
Lists can be pasted from most List Builders: Ryan Kingston, Armada Warlords, and the Android Armada Fleet Designer are best supported
Lines in red will not spawn.
If that is a mistake, Click "?" to attempt to resolve it.
To spawn individual ships/squadrons/ugprades/objectives, access the "Ships" and "Upgrades" tabs
Command Dials are now unified. They will be spawned with ship spawner, and can be found next to the Defense Token sources next to Rules.
They now use "States". To Change Dial, press 1-4:
1. Repair
2. Navigate
3. Concentrate Fire
4. Squadron
You can "peek" at the value of the Command Dial by hovering it and holding alt+shift together
Flip a dial by typing "f" while holding it.
They can be stacked on ships or the metallic Command Bases, and are meant to be reused each round

Button.text: Player with Most Victory Tokens gets 75 pts
1/2 Ship Cost of Enemy Ships with Damage Cards
